Cristiano Ronaldo was nicknamed 'cry baby' as a youngster due to the tantrums he used to have when he wasn't passed the ball. 
That is according to one of his childhood teammates, Ricardo Santos, who played alongside the Real Madrid superstar for amateur side CF Andorinha in Madeira. 
Ronaldo's father worked as a kitman at the club - but that didn't stop the former Manchester United man being given the embarrassing nickname. 
"Cry-baby, yes, because Ronaldo already loved to win like he loves today and when he lost and when other kids didn't pass the ball to him he used to cry," Santos told Reuters. Ronaldo has gone on to have a glittering career (Photo: AFP) He led Portugal to the Euro 2016 title (Photo: Matthias Hangst) Read More Real Madrid superstar Cristiano Ronaldo beats Barcelona rival Lionel Messi by almost Â£10m to top yearly earnings table 
But the Portuguese's desire to win has seen him go on and have a glittering career, winning the Champions League three times and picking up the Euro 2016 trophy with Portugal last summer.
